name: NIST CSF 1.1 - Security functions
description: Security functions inspired from NIST CSF 1.1

fields.name: ID.AM-1
fields.description: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried.

fields.name: ID.AM-2
fields.description: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried.

fields.name: ID.AM-3
fields.description: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped.

fields.name: ID.AM-4
fields.description: External information systems are catalogued.

fields.name: ID.AM-5
fields.description: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value.

fields.name: ID.AM-6
fields.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established.

fields.name: ID.BE-1
fields.description: The organization’s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated.

fields.name: ID.BE-2
fields.description: The organization’s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated.

fields.name: ID.BE-3
fields.description: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated.

fields.name: ID.BE-4
fields.description: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established.

fields.name: ID.BE-5
fields.description: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations).

fields.name: ID.GV-1
fields.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated.

fields.name: ID.GV-2
fields.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners.

fields.name: ID.GV-3
fields.description: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed.

fields.name: ID.GV-4
fields.description: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks.

fields.name: ID.RA-1
fields.description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented.

fields.name: ID.RA-2
fields.description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

fields.name: ID.RA-3
fields.description: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented.

fields.name: ID.RA-4
fields.description: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified.

fields.name: ID.RA-5
fields.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk.

fields.name: ID.RA-6
fields.description: Risk responses are identified and prioritized.

fields.name: ID.RM-1
fields.description: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

fields.name: ID.RM-2
fields.description: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed.

fields.name: ID.RM-3
fields.description: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis.

fields.name: ID.SC-1
fields.description: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

fields.name: ID.SC-2
fields.description: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process.

fields.name: ID.SC-3
fields.description: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.

fields.name: ID.SC-4
fields.description: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

fields.name: ID.SC-5
fields.description: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers.

fields.name: PR.AC-1
fields.description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes.

fields.name: PR.AC-2
fields.description: Physical access to assets is managed and protected.

fields.name: PR.AC-3
fields.description: Remote access is managed.

fields.name: PR.AC-4
fields.description: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.

fields.name: PR.AC-5
fields.description: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation).

fields.name: PR.AC-6
fields.description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions.

fields.name: PR.AC-7
fields.description: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks).

fields.name: PR.AT-1
fields.description: All users are informed and trained.

fields.name: PR.AT-2
fields.description: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities.

fields.name: PR.AT-3
fields.description: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities.

fields.name: PR.AT-4
fields.description: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities.

fields.name: PR.AT-5
fields.description: Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities.

fields.name: PR.DS-1
fields.description: Data-at-rest is protected.

fields.name: PR.DS-2
fields.description: Data-in-transit is protected.

fields.name: PR.DS-3
fields.description: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition.

fields.name: PR.DS-4
fields.description: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained.

fields.name: PR.DS-5
fields.description: Protections against data leaks are implemented.

fields.name: PR.DS-6
fields.description: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity.

fields.name: PR.DS-7
fields.description: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment.

fields.name: PR.DS-8
fields.description: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity.

fields.name: PR.IP-1
fields.description: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality).

fields.name: PR.IP-2
fields.description: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented.

fields.name: PR.IP-3
fields.description: Configuration change control processes are in place.

fields.name: PR.IP-4
fields.description: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested.

fields.name: PR.IP-5
fields.description: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met.

fields.name: PR.IP-6
fields.description: Data is destroyed according to policy.

fields.name: PR.IP-7
fields.description: Protection processes are improved.

fields.name: PR.IP-8
fields.description: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared.

fields.name: PR.IP-9
fields.description: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed.

fields.name: PR.IP-10
fields.description: Response and recovery plans are tested.

fields.name: PR.IP-11
fields.description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening).

fields.name: PR.IP-12
fields.description: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented.

fields.name: PR.MA-1
fields.description: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools.

fields.name: PR.MA-2
fields.description: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access.

fields.name: PR.PT-1
fields.description: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy.

fields.name: PR.PT-2
fields.description: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy.

fields.name: PR.PT-3
fields.description: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities.

fields.name: PR.PT-4
fields.description: Communications and control networks are protected.

fields.name: PR.PT-5
fields.description: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.

fields.name: DE.AE-1
fields.description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed.

fields.name: DE.AE-2
fields.description: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods.

fields.name: DE.AE-3
fields.description: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors.

fields.name: DE.AE-4
fields.description: Impact of events is determined.

fields.name: DE.AE-5
fields.description: Incident alert thresholds are established.

fields.name: DE.CM-1
fields.description: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

fields.name: DE.CM-2
fields.description: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

fields.name: DE.CM-3
fields.description: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

fields.name: DE.CM-4
fields.description: Malicious code is detected.

fields.name: DE.CM-5
fields.description: Unauthorized mobile code is detected.

fields.name: DE.CM-6
fields.description: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

fields.name: DE.CM-7
fields.description: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed.

fields.name: DE.CM-8
fields.description: Vulnerability scans are performed.

fields.name: DE.DP-1
fields.description: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability.

fields.name: DE.DP-2
fields.description: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements.

fields.name: DE.DP-3
fields.description: Detection processes are tested.

fields.name: DE.DP-4
fields.description: Event detection information is communicated.

fields.name: DE.DP-5
fields.description: Detection processes are continuously improved.

fields.name: RS.RP-1
fields.description: Response plan is executed during or after an incident.

fields.name: RS.CO-1
fields.description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed.

fields.name: RS.CO-2
fields.description: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria.

fields.name: RS.CO-3
fields.description: Information is shared consistent with response plans.

fields.name: RS.CO-4
fields.description: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans.

fields.name: RS.CO-5
fields.description: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness.

fields.name: RS.AN-1
fields.description: Notifications from detection systems are investigated.

fields.name: RS.AN-2
fields.description: The impact of the incident is understood.

fields.name: RS.AN-3
fields.description: Forensics are performed.

fields.name: RS.AN-4
fields.description: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans.

fields.name: RS.AN-5
fields.description: Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)

fields.name: RS.MI-1
fields.description: Incidents are contained.

fields.name: RS.MI-2
fields.description: Incidents are mitigated.

fields.name: RS.MI-3
fields.description: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks.

fields.name: RS.IM-1
fields.description: Response plans incorporate lessons learned.

fields.name: RS.IM-2
fields.description: Response strategies are updated.

fields.name: RC.RP-1
fields.description: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident.

fields.name: RC.IM-1
fields.description: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned.

fields.name: RC.IM-2
fields.description: Recovery strategies are updated.

fields.name: RC.CO-1
fields.description: Public relations are managed.

fields.name: RC.CO-2
fields.description: Reputation is repaired after an incident.

fields.name: RC.CO-3
fields.description: Recovery activities are communicated to internal and external stakeholders as well as executive and management teams.
